page.title: 11INDUSTRY IN STEWARTON
page.content: Many knitwear factories have closed in the past ten years. However the Spinners and Dyers,T.W Mackie and Sons are flourishing at Bridgend as is the old Bonnet making firm, Sim's at Wylie Place. Domino Textiles at Bridgend, McCrae in Avenue St,Newtown knitwear and Top Scotch in Wylie Place are producing many garments using fashionable man made materials for knitting. Wilson and Wylie, toolmakers still produce small tools but have recently branched out to hiring out small machinery and tools for gardens and D.I.Y to the general public. Rafferty in High Street and Bridgend make wrought iron goods. At David Dale Avenue there is Lainshaw Farm Eggs packing and marketing eggs produced on Robert Howie's farms.
